speaker: Vinnie
text: [_v.o._] Anyway, Doc, I got this thing.  It's, uh, got to do with women.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I sense you're having trouble finding Miss Right.

speaker: Vinnie
text: What, are you nuts?  I meet Miss Right most every night! Eager young college girls, tough career women hungry for a little R-and-R, if you know what I'm saying...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're leaving precious little room for misinterpretation.  But I sense, despite these frequent dalliances, that you're still not truly happy.

speaker: Vinnie
text: Well, sure I am.  It's just that I lost a pinky ring in one of their houses -- star sapphire, beautiful thing.  I figured if I went public with it on your show, I had a pretty good chance of getting it back. _Roz rolls her eyes.  Noel Shempsky comes into her booth and shows her a piece of paper._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Vinnie, it's obvious you know nothing about this show, or how to treat women.  But even more appalling, you know even less about jewelry!  A pinkie no more needs a ring than a neck needs a gold medallion!

speaker: Vinnie
text: Just shoot me, why don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd be delighted! [_disconnects Vinnie_] We'll be right back after this. _He goes to commercial.  Roz comes into his booth, and Noel sticks his head in after her._

speaker: Noel
text: Hi, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Roz
text: He's driving me crazy!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz, we can't all choose our admirers.

speaker: Roz
text: It's gone way beyond the admiring stage.  Have you seen this petition he's got going around?

speaker: Noel
text: Hi, Dr. Crane.  Could you sign this petition someone "anonymously" posted in the lunchroom?  It's to the talented producers of "Star Trek," suggesting a new character.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reading_] "The all-powerful space vixen... Rozalinda!"

speaker: Frasier
text: "Four-breasted queen of the planet Rozniak!"  I'll sign that.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_signing it_] Well, Roz, television will never improve unless the viewers speak out!

speaker: Noel
text: Thanks.  I'd better go.  Well, [_makes the Vulcan salute at Roz_] live long and prosper!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, just go! [_Noel leaves_] I am the joke of the station. When I used to come in in the morning the guard would say, "Morning, Roz."  Now it's "All hail, Rozalinda!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I think you should be flattered.  Noel's attempt to immortalize you is-is akin to... a love poem written by Robert Browning to his wife.

speaker: Roz
text: Did he ever write a poem where he gave her two extra breasts?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'd have to check my English Lit notes, but I think not, no.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Yes?  Niles, Niles, slow down, I can hardly understand you!

speaker: Roz
text: What is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris is missing! [_Roz gasps_] What?  No, I don't think you should drag the koi pond!  Listen, I'll be right over!  All right, just hang tight! [_hangs up_] Roz, Roz, how much time left in the show?

speaker: Roz
text: No, you go, do whatever you have to do; I'll handle things here.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're sure you can manage?

speaker: Roz
text: If I can nurse quadruplets and still find time to rule Rozniak, I can do anything!  _Frasier grabs his jacket and briefcase and leaves.  FADE OUT_  **THANK GOD GUCCI WAS CLOSED**  _Scene Two -- Niles's House Frasier comes in the front door.  Daphne is pacing the living room; Martin is on the couch with the phone in his hand._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, what's going on?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Maris is really gone; I'm on the phone with the station right now.

speaker: Daphne
text: Apparently she just vanished.  No note, nothing.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier, thank God you're here. [_hugs Frasier_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Any news, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I asked the neighbors if they'd seen any strange cars in the neighborhood.  One reported spotting something called a "minivan."  But that was weeks ago!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's no need to panic, Niles.  I'm sure she's all right.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear me... [_picks up the poker from the fireplace_] I don't want to alarm you, Dr. Crane, but I'm getting a very strong vibration off this.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear God.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can see Mrs. Crane.  She's waving this poker around and screaming, "You thief!  Get out!  You'll never get away with this!"

speaker: Niles
text: Wait... no, I remember.  That's what she said to the decorator when he tried to double-bill her for the andirons.

speaker: Daphne
text: I was wondering why the intruder was wearing Toreador pants.

speaker: Martin
text: [_into phone_] Yeah, Mike, I'm still here.  Yeah, that's right, she's been missing three days.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, excuse me?  She's been missing for three days and you're just panic-stricken now?

speaker: Niles
text: I only just realized it.  The last two nights, I knocked on Maris's bedroom door to wish her goodnight and I was greeted with a chilly silence, so naturally I assumed everything was status quo.

speaker: Martin
text: [_into phone_] Uh, thin.  Make that VERY thin.  Caucasian. VERY Caucasian.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh God, what could be happening to her?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, wait, wait, you got something?  O.K., uh-huh, O.K. [_to Niles_] Mike ran a check on Maris's credit cards, there's been a whole bunch of charges in New York.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, God.  She's been kidnapped.  Someone's using her credit cards.

speaker: Martin
text: [_into phone_] Yeah, O.K., slow down.  Armani... Valentino... Cartier... Tiffany...

speaker: Niles
text: Any restaurants?

speaker: Martin
text: Any restaurants? [_to Niles_] Not a one.

speaker: Niles
text: [_springing up with joy_] She's alive!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles!  You're certain!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes!  From that list, she's recreating her infamous "Sakes alive, I'm thirty-five" shopping spree!

speaker: Martin
text: O.K., Mike, thanks a lot.  Yeah, I owe you.  Bye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, I'm so relieved.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, so am I.  I'm exhausted.  I was so scared.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier?  What's wrong?  You look positively uncelebratory. Aren't you glad Maris is O.K.?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course I am.  It's just that... well, here you are, all panic-stricken and scared to death, and she's off on some shopping trip!  Don't you find that the least bit upsetting?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I suppose her behavior was a tad inconsiderate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, she left without so much as a note or a phone call!

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, stay out of this.  It's between Niles and his wife.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm sorry, Dad, but this is not the first time we've experienced Maris's selfish behavior!  She always puts her needs before his!  She never attends family functions! Doesn't that make you angry?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, over the years I've learned to accept Maris's eccentricities.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, she's not being eccentric.  She's being arrogant and selfish!

speaker: Martin
text: If he says he's not angry, he's not angry.

speaker: Niles
text: And even if I were angry, what would you have me do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Let it out!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I am letting it out! [_holds out his hands_] I'm getting hives!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that is a triumph of self-expression!  My God, man, why don't you just let out some of the words that you're dying to say?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh God, I am so sick of you and your relentless psychobabble!  _He grabs a glass knick-knack off the piano and smashes it to the floor._

speaker: Frasier
text: A-ha!  You're not angry at me!  That was directed at Maris!

speaker: Niles
text: Nope, that was for you!  This is for Maris!

speaker: Martin
text: Whoa!  O.K., all right, Niles, now you got it out of your system!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but it felt so good!  Let me do one more!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Niles, this is good, this is healthy!  But you've got to channel it!  You must talk to Maris!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh no, wait!  That's beautiful! [_grabs a porcelain "Commodore" statue_] Here, this one's hideous!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I gave him that for a wedding present!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, all right, here!

speaker: Marta
text: [_gasps_] _Dios Mio!_

speaker: Niles
text: [_smashing_] Oh, Marta!  This feels wonderful!  You must try it!

speaker: Niles
text: I meant at your house.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh my God, it's Maris!

speaker: Niles
text: Maris?!  What?!  You said she was in New York!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't know, she probably flew back!

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right, no one panic, there's an easy solution to this! [_grabs another vase_] Frasier, bash me on the head with this, we'll tell Maris there was a break-in!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, stop it!  God, you are the damaged party here, not Maris!

speaker: Niles
text: But-but-but-but the mess!

speaker: Frasier
text: This mess is the physical manifestation of years of repressed anger!  It's time to draw a line in the sand and say, "I have had enough!"  My God, man, _show_ her your mess!

speaker: Niles
text: You're right.  It's time I told Maris I will not tolerate this behavior.  I'm going up there and I'm going to demand an apology!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good for you!  _Niles walks to the stairs.  Before going up, he takes the Ming vase and tosses it over his shoulder, smashing it._

speaker: Niles
text: I always hated that dynasty. _FADE TO:  Scene Three -- Frasier's Apartment Later that evening, Daphne, Martin, and Frasier are riding the elevator up._

speaker: Daphne
text: How're you feeling, Mr. Crane?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm fine, I wish you'd quit asking me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a reasonable question for a man who just ate a cut of prime rib the size of a hatbox.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, whose fault's that?  You're the one who was too embarrassed to walk out with a doggie bag.  For what it cost, that meat was coming with me, one way or another!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_checking her watch_] Goodness, we've been gone three hours. Probably have a dog with a full bladder in there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lord, let's hope so. _As soon as Daphne unlocks the door, Eddie runs out with his leash and into the elevator._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Daphne, how do you feel about taking him for a walk? I just want to get in there and unbuckle my pants -- since I wasn't allowed to at the restaurant!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, sure.  We all know how Eddie needs his exercise.  I mean, we wouldn't want all that fatty meat he eats clogging up his aging arteries until his poor old heart gives out.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh and, uh, why don't you pick up some half-and-half at the corner store too?

speaker: Daphne
text: Get moving, old man!  _She hauls him into the elevator with her and Eddie, and they ride down.  As Frasier steps into the living room, Niles steps in from the kitchen.  His jacket is off, his shirtsleeves rolled up, he has an open Ballantine in one hand and the rest of the six-pack in the other._

speaker: Niles
text: There y'are!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry to startle you, I let myself in.  Want a beer?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: I have to thank you for putting me in touch with my anger. I had no idea how therapeutic it was to just pick something up and smash it!  _As he says this, he lays a hand on one of Frasier's African sculptures.  Frasier steps forward and surreptitiously puts his hand on the base._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... you're welcome, Niles.  But, um, how did things go with Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  _Niles goes to sit on the couch.  Frasier removes the sculpture to a safe place._

speaker: Niles
text: I marched into her room and demanded an explanation.  It seems that over lunch with her garden club, Maris heard that the new Couture lines had arrived in New York.  So she hied her way to the airport, and in her haste she forgot to leave me a note.

speaker: Frasier
text: Unbelievable!

speaker: Niles
text: Just thinking about it makes me furious!

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: So I told her, "Maris, you were inconsiderate, and when you are ready to apologize, I can be reached at Frasier's!" Then I stormed out and slammed the door.  Of course, it was that fourteenth-century Bavarian cathedral door, so I had to get two of the servants to help me slam it.  But what it lacked in spontaneity it made up for in resonance!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, you know I'm not usually one to toot my own horn, but I think in this case I was on the mark.  You feel good, don't you?

speaker: Niles
text: I feel great!

speaker: Frasier
text: You feel empowered?

speaker: Niles
text: So empowered!

speaker: Frasier
text: And you'd like to switch to wine now, wouldn't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, please.  _As Niles puts down the beer can and wipes off his tongue, the phone rings.  Frasier answers._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Oh, hello, Maris.  Yes, Niles is here.  I'll see if he's available.  _Frasier and Niles wait for a few seconds, letting her stew, then Niles takes the phone._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Maris.  Mmm-Hmm.  Well, I know you're not used to me speaking to you that way.  That's rather the point, wouldn't you agree?  Uh-huh.  I see.  Well, thank you.  I know this was a very difficult call for you to make.  Goodbye.

speaker: Niles
text: She wants a divorce.  _Frasier drops his thumb to a half-and-half position.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene One -- Frasier's Apartment It's later that night.  Martin, Frasier, and Niles, are in the living room.  Niles has just hung up the phone._

speaker: Niles
text: It's no use.  She still won't talk to me.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, just give her time to cool off.  Call her again in the morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Geez, you must be exhausted, Niles.  Why don't you call it a day and get some rest, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: Do you have a blanket for me?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh now, Niles, you've been going through a rough time lately, you're not sleeping on any couch.  You can sleep in Frasier's bed.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: You're sure it wouldn't be too much trouble?

speaker: Martin
text: No trouble.

speaker: Niles
text: I wouldn't want to impose.

speaker: Martin
text: No, don't worry about it, you're family.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was very generous of you.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's the least you can do after getting him kicked out of the house.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad, I was just trying to do what's right for him.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, trust me.  I handled domestic disputes for thirty years. The first rule is, don't take sides.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's just a little difficult when it happens to be your own brother.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's the second rule.  When it's your own family, keep your nose out of their personal problems.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is starting to make some sense.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, maybe you should listen to your old man once in a while.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.

speaker: Martin
text: I mean, I'm not a psychiatrist or anything, I'm just a cop.

speaker: Frasier
text: But a darn good one.

speaker: Martin
text: You're going to talk to Maris, aren't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll be back in an hour.  _Frasier leaves.  Martin shakes his head.  FADE TO:_  **WHAT LIGHT BREAKS THROUGH YONDER WINDOW**  _Scene Two -- Niles's House Marta is sweeping up the last of the mess in the living room. Frasier is standing outside the glass doors._

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't ignore me, Marta!

speaker: Marta
text: Go away!

speaker: Frasier
text: Let me in, I need to speak with Mrs. Crane!

speaker: Marta
text: Missy Crane say, no you Dr. Crane, no other Dr. Crane, and no Crane with a cane!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, at least tell her that I'm here!

speaker: Marta
text: She know.  Everybody know.  _Marta goes up the stairs, turning off the light.  Frasier steps back and looks up at the second floor._

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris?  Maris, we need to talk!  Oh, look, look, I know you're up there, I can see you through the shutters!  All right, if you won't talk, listen!  Niles didn't ask me to come here, I came because I care about both of you.  I realize that Niles spoke to you rather harshly today.  Truth be told, is it was I that urged him to express his anger.  As hard as it was for you to listen to such criticism, you're a fair-minded woman and you must concede that he had a right to be upset! [_the window opens_] Oh!  Oh, Maris!  By opening that window you're opening up a window to a long and happy marriage, that's good! _A bucket of water is dumped on his head; he splutters for a few seconds._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, you're expressing your anger!  That's good, too! But, listen, in spite of that last little outburst, I am not going to leave here until we've had some sort of a breakthrough! [_attack dogs barking_] Well, I see our time is up, I'll let myself out!  _He runs like hell.  FADE TO:  Scene Three -- Frasier's Apartment The next morning.  Frasier is standing in front of the open refrigerator.  Eddie is sitting on the floor behind him, staring._

speaker: Frasier
text: I know you're there.  After last night, frankly, I've had quite enough of your kind.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can stare all you like.  I'm not going to give you anything to eat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right, here.  You might as well finish off this god- awful Shepherd's Pie that Daphne made.  Lord knows it isn't fit for humans. [_turns around and sees her_] Did that sound like "humans?"  I said "Mormons."

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not at your quickest first thing in the morning, are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it was a rough night.

speaker: Martin
text: [_coming in_] Well, maybe next time you'll listen to your old man and not come between a husband and his wife.

speaker: Frasier
text: And here's Dad, all sleep-refreshed and bright-eyed, ready to resume his lecture!  _They bring the fixings for breakfast out to the dining table.  A blanket on the couch shows where Niles slept, but there's no sign of him except a note on the table._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh look, your brother left us a note.

speaker: Frasier[_reading_] "Dear Dad, Frasier, & Daphne
text: when you wake up this morning I'll be gone.  Thank you for all your help, but I don't want to be a burden any longer."

speaker: Daphne
text: You don't think... no, I'm sure this is all completely harmless.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, my gun's still locked up... and the door to the balcony's closed...

speaker: Frasier
text: And we all know that Daphne's Shepherd's Pie is still in the refrigerator.  _Daphne gives him a dirty look.  Niles comes in the door with a shopping bag._

speaker: Niles
text: Hi-ho, everyone!  What are you all doing inside on such a beautiful, clear autumn day?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you seem awfully chipper this morning.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I woke up this morning and I had a realization.  Like it or not, my life is changing.  I'm single now, so I went out and rented a bachelor pad.  Ooh, is that coffee?

speaker: Martin
text: Don't you think that's jumping the gun a little bit?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh no, Dad.  Maris, uh, ordered me to get my stuff out of there by sundown, or else she'd turn it over to a church bazaar.  Oh, and I got these jeans! [_pulls a new pair of jeans out of the shopping bag_] Right?  Right?  And I'm starting a goatee, and I'm thinking of joining a gym, but I don't know whether aerobics or weight training is the quickest route to "buff!"  Any thoughts?

speaker: Frasier
text: One thought: seek help!  Niles, you've just been through a very traumatic experience here and you are deep in denial here.  You are going through some very extreme emotions right now, and rather than feeling them, you're denying they even exist.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not denying my feelings.  I'm so in tune with my emotions that I was able to move through them quickly.  In fact, I've logged them all in my journal.

speaker: Niles
text: Let's see, where are we?  Here... [_reading_] "5 AM: Blissful confusion.  Something's happened, but what?" "5:01: Ah, yes.  An overwhelming sense of emptiness and despair." "5:07..." - this one's hard to read... oh, right! - "Wept uncontrollably." "6:15: All cried out.  Hungry now.  Ate entire box of Frosted Flakes, they're gr-r-r-reat!" [_closes journal_] So don't you tell me I'm not in touch with my emotions!

speaker: Martin
text: "9:45: get out the butterfly net." **DENIAL AIN'T JUST A RIVER**  _Scene Four -- Niles's House Niles is standing to the living room, addressing the assembled household staff.  Frasier and Marta are on the couch._

speaker: Niles
text: It's not easy for me to say goodbye, especially after so many years -- all we've shared, all that we've meant to one another. Jean-Pierre, Marie, Bernard -- thank you for your years of devoted service.  As a personal favor, please look after Mrs. Crane.  It'll be just you and her from now on.

speaker: Marta
text: Uh, the staff, they have a question: Can we come with you?

speaker: Niles
text: Marta, I'm afraid this is a road I must walk alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Must be very painful, isn't it?

speaker: Niles
text: Painful doesn't begin to describe it.  But they're strong, they'll get over it. [_some moving men come down carrying boxes; Niles goes over to them_] Oh, watch that, careful with those!

speaker: Frasier
text: Look at him, Dad.  My God, he's locked in denial!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, for God's sake.  First you get him to move out, then when he does he's not upset enough for you.  There's no pleasing you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what would please me would be to see him actually experience some real emotion!  My God, he's walking through this thing like a zombie!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's everything.  Shall we?

speaker: Martin
text: You know, there's no hurry, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, actually there is.  I have aerobics at five, and then I'm meeting with my decorator at six-thirty.  Off we go!  _Frasier and Martin get up and head for the door.  Niles starts to follow them, then stops and turns around._

speaker: Niles
text: Have I got my wallet? [_pats pocket_] Yes. [_turns to leave, but turns back again_] Have I got my checkbook? [_pats other pocket_] Yes. [_turns to leave, but turns back again_] Have I lost my MIND?!  I can't leave!  This is my home!  You're not taking me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, open the door!

speaker: Niles
text: Nope, nope, bye-bye!  Thanks for coming, I'll tell Maris you sent your best!

speaker: Martin
text: Now, Niles, calm down.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, don't calm down!  Let it out!  This is very healing!

speaker: Niles
text: Don't you ever let up?

speaker: Martin
text: Look, everything's gonna be fine.

speaker: Niles
text: No, it isn't.  There's no life for me out there!

speaker: Martin
text: You're just excited.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't want to be a bachelor.  I didn't like it the first time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, look, just sit down for a second, O.K.?

speaker: Niles
text: Where, Frasier? [_wanders around the room; puts his hand on an armchair_] Here, in the chair that Maris and I picked out on our honeymoon in Vienna? [_goes to the piano_] Or here, where I sit Sunday mornings playing Mahler while Maris dabs at her watercolors? [_goes to the fireplace_] Perhaps here, where we sipped champagne on our last anniversary.  Guess that really was our last anniversary.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles...

speaker: Marta
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Marta?

speaker: Marta
text: Missy Crane give me message for you: if you say is all your fault, you no have to leave.

speaker: Niles
text: ...I can stay?

speaker: Marta
text: She waiting upstairs.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, before you make your decision, just make sure that you're remembering things the way they really were.  Yes, you bought that chair on your honeymoon in Vienna.  But remember, you wanted to buy the chair that you saw in Paris. Yes, you sit at the piano every Sunday morning and play Mahler for Maris.  But you hate Mahler!  Besides Maris, who doesn't?!

speaker: Martin
text: Look, just give him a little air here...

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, all I'm saying is that along with the good things in your marriage, there were problems -- things you said you couldn't live with anymore.  Now if you want those to change, you have got to stand up to her.  If you back down now, you will go through the rest of your life feeling weak and small because you never had the courage to say, "I will not let you treat me like this, Lilith! ...Maris!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I've lost all credibility here.  Dad, would you please say something?

speaker: Martin
text: I told you, I'm not telling him what to do.

speaker: Niles
text: I wouldn't mind knowing what you think.

speaker: Martin
text: It doesn't matter what I think.  What matters is what you think.  Now if you want to walk up those stairs, we'll support you.  If you want to go out that door, we'll support you there, too.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you, nuts?!  You're gonna go up there and grovel to that woman after what she did to you?!

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I was just going to get my car keys. [_picks them up off the table by the stairs_] But thanks for the impartial advice, Dad. _Frasier and Martin walk out the glass doors.  Niles follows them. He pauses on the threshold, looking around the living room, then closes the doors behind him and walks away from the house.  END OF ACT TWO_
